entry.title: mediastream: fix invalid UTF-8 generation in traits tests
entry.content:
Currently, the MediaStream traits tests generate random byte vectors and

stick them into a Mojo string, which is illegal - Mojo strings are

required to always contain valid UTF-8. In this case, the string is

supposed to always be UTF-8 and the test is incorrect, so this change

has the test generate a random string that is valid UTF-8.

entry.title: [DIPS] Create content::DipsDelegate and use it for DB prepopulation.
entry.content:
This is the beginning of Phase 2 of moving DIPS from //chrome to

//content (see go/dips-move).



To break dependencies on //chrome, we create a new interface for Content

Embedders to implement: DipsDelegate. ChromeDipsDelegate is a subclass

which will maintain the current behavior in Chrome.



Eventually we will get a pointer to DipsDelegate via

ContentBrowserClient, but that isn't accessible from //chrome. So for

now we temporarily defined ChromeDipsDelegate::GetInstance() to get it.



This CL defines the first method: GetEngagedSites(). The default

implementation returns no sites. ChromeDipsDelegate's override queries

the SiteEngagementService for all sites with any engagement (which was

the previous behavior).



There should be no change in behavior with this CL.



Bug: 40883201

Change-Id: I79f8f222d80ebc0eb48f8875b4fdf16453c07524

entry.title: [bookmarks] Plumb through BookmarkId when fetching bookmark url images
entry.content:
With butter, sync consent will fail even though the bookmark is

associated with the google account. This patch plumbs the bookmark id

through so we can conditionally skip the sync consent if google

already knows about the bookmark. Caching will be switched to

BookmarkId to avoid local bookmarks from hitting the cache.

entry.title: Apply heatmap palm detection results on touch events.
entry.content:
We match the touch events with heatmap palm detection results

according to their timestamp. If the device supports heatmap and the

heatmap service is available, we will rely only on heatmap results,

otherwise we fallback to firmware results.

entry.title: [shared storage] Support cross-origin worklet
entry.content:
For the sharedStorage.createWorklet() API, relax the same-origin

restriction to additionally allow cross-origin script, in which case

a cross-origin worklet will be created.



How:

- Rely on CORS for the worklet to be created/used by the embedder.

- In general, we want to mimic the subframe's process allocation

behavior (i.e. it should end up using a process as if an iframe is

created with the script URL). It leverages the process allocation

and management logic from service workers and re-use SiteInstanceImpl::CreateForServiceWorker(). To keep this

CL focused, the refactoring will occur in a separate CL, as it

will involve refactoring other downstream components like

'UnmatchedServiceWorkerProcessTracker'.



Explainer: https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/130

Spec: https://github.com/WICG/shared-storage/pull/131

Design doc:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1QTaaroCMeFVZVghI6JkUcDvmDQEacjvpyTfk6mpvQhA/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 325302836

entry.title: Remove --gtest_filter from command line when also specified in --gtest_flagfile.
entry.content:
Chrome's test launcher understands --gtest_filter and uses that, if

specified, to determine the actual set of tests to run. However, the

test launcher launches child processes to run the actual tests, using

--gtest_filter to control which subset of tests each child process

executes.



This means that the child process sees --gtest_filter specified twice:

once in the flagfile, and once on the command line. GoogleTest provides

no guarantees about which one "wins"; without Abseil flags, the flagfile

wins, but with Abseil flags, the command line wins.



The easiest solution is to not pass --gtest_filter in both places; since

the test runner launcher has already applied the filtering and

determined the exact subset of tests to run, just defer to that.



Bug: 326607005

Change-Id: Iff33e3626442006ba5504ec3b3f0a1d81d6e8c0e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5318182

entry.title: Fix misalligned address in hunspell::NodeReader::ReaderForLookupAt
entry.content:
With the Hunspell spell checking library, we are using a custom wrapper

to read the dictionaries from files. In that custom wrapper, we were

reading by using reinterpret_cast to interpret an offset into a pointer,

and then reading the bytes at that pointer for the child_offset.



The spell checking code appears to have been working properly in the

field. However, the current code caused fuzzing test failures, and

those failures are blocking other tests, so we need to fix this to

unblock other tests.



It turns out that we were casting a value to a pointer that did not

have proper alignment (for instance, a pointer to a 32 bit int needs

to be 4 byte allinged, but this pointer was not). While it has often

worked in older compilers, it turns out this is undefined behavior.



Instead of relying on undefined behavior, the right thing to do is to

use std::memcpy to copy the bytes from the misalligned address into

their final destination (either an int32 or an int16 in this case).



Bug: 40940917

Change-Id: I8aeba9ee8000b51e98863813235d8dceb1c41ceb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5293726

entry.title: [crypto] Introduce UnexportableKeyMac
entry.content:
Introduce UnexportableKeyMac, an implementation of unexportable keys

built on top of Apple's Secure Enclave.



The implementation is still missing several details which will come

in follow-ups:

* There is no way to query for availability, a TPM is assumed to be

present at the moment.

* There is no way to customize the request, e.g. to pass an

authenticated LAContext.

* //components/unexportable_keys needs some way to inject the keychain

access group.

* There is no way to delete keys.



This implementation largely follows go/unexportable-keys-mac, and

updates FakeAppleKeychain to more closely match new behaviour we need.



Bug: 326451282

entry.content:
Do not end upload in GetDestinationFolderUrl() as the caller

(GetODFSMetadataAndStartIOTask()) will also end the upload if

GetDestinationFolderUrl() fails. This can result in a double-ended

upload, leading to the UploadResult metric being logged twice.



Instead bring the logic into GetODFSMetadataAndStartIOTask() to handle

all of the upload ends.

entry.title: Refresh app-bound encryption metrics.
entry.content:
Path validation was changed in crrev.com/c/5319332 and

crrev.com/c/5322227 and it is believed that these will

improve reliability of path validation.



In addition, checks are now made in the browser to determine

whether or not the client will be able to support app-bound

encryption, which is now reported via a new metric.



Because some clients might have incorrectly captured an invalid

application identity during the encrypt phase of the previous

metrics, they might be wedged into this invalid state and

suffering an inability to ever decrypt data.



This CL therefore also forces all clients to perform a new

re-encrypt followed by subsequent decrypts to gather new baseline

metrics on the reliability of the new code. The old pref is

therefore deprecated and cleared, and a new pref is used instead.



The current set of metrics are deprecated and replaced with a

set specific to path validation. This ensures clients running

the new code can be clearly identified.



BUG=41493095

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS=OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Decrypt and OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.Encrypt were replaced by OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.PathValidation.Decrypt and OSCrypt.AppBoundEncryption.PathValidation.Encrypt



Change-Id: I833b485bd3c091f7809774b0cbeb9c06830ba7c5

entry.title: Add CSSValuePhase parameter to CSSValueFromComputedStyleInternal
entry.content:
There's special-casing in ComputedStyleUtils::ComputedPropertyValue()

for properties whose computed value differs from resolved value. The set

of such properties is larger than previously understood, so to avoid

an excessive number of special cases, this CL starts a refactor to push

CSSValuePhase into CSSProperty::CSSValueFromComputedStyle() so that

properties can define their own behaviors.



The changes here are only to CSSValuePhase into css_property.h, add the

parameter to the heavily overridden CSSValueFromComputedStyleInternal

method, and fix up call sites. Further plumbing and functional changes

will come in follow-up CLs.



Bug: 40137692

entry.title: IDB: shard backing stores across threads, part 1
entry.content:
This change is the first of a series that implements backing store

sharding across threads. As the backing stores/bucket contexts no

longer share very many resources, and what they do share is thread

safe, the biggest hurdle at this point is expected to come from

making code asynchronous that was previously synchronous.



Part 1 (this change) takes the first two steps:



a) add a base::Feature to toggle this work.

b) making the BucketContext => ContextImpl flows asynchronous

(these are wholly contained in IndexedDBBucketContext::Delegate)



The only part of IndexedDBBucketContext::Delegate that can not easily

be made asynchronous is on_ready_for_destruction. There could be a

race between `on_ready_for_destruction` being in-flight, and a new

connection being opened via BindIndexedDB() (i.e. a new tab calls

window.indexedDB for the first time). To handle this,

IndexedBBucketContext::AddReceiver rejects new bindings when

destruction has already commenced. The bounced receiver will go back

to IndexedBBucketContextImpl which should create a new bucket context

to accept it.



Bug: 40279485

entry.title: Avoid forced layout & style calculation when loading an empty iframe
entry.content:
This fixes a common scenario where adding an iframe with no src to the

document forces a style calculation & layout on the embedding document,

resulting in observed long main thread jank on major sites (e.g. rayban.com).



We have to perform a synchronous navigation for an iframe with no src.

but the forced style/layout is necessary only for a few minor cases:

- Responding to synchronous changes to the iframe's

MediaQueryList (iframe.contentWindow.matchMedia(...).onchange).

Without the forced layout, the size of the frame is counted as 0x0

for the purpose of those change events.

- Responding to `resize` event from the empty iframe, that originate

from forced layout changes in the parent

(iframe.contentWindow.onresize). The frame is considered as not fully

loaded because the current logic uses DidFirstLayout() to assert that.



To remedy this, this CL does the following:

- Don't force a style/layout when an empty subframe is loaded.

- Allow firing the resize events when this is a fully loaded

empty subframe, regardless of its DidLayout() result.

- When calling matchMedia on a fully loaded empty subframe, we force

a layout, to ensure MediaQueryList.change events are fired correctly.



This is behind a feature flag for finching.



Added a test that ensures that simply adding an empty iframe doesn't

by itself force a layout.



Bug: 324572951

entry.title: Only consider dynamic validity when validating parent process
entry.content:
By default `SecCodeCheckValidity` on a running process validates both

that the process's code signature is valid and that it matches the

signature of the app bundle on disk. This logic fails for apps such as

Chrome that can be updated on disk while they're running.



`ProcessIsSignedAndFulfillsRequirement` is updated to take an optional

flag to request that only the dynamic validity of the process be

checked. This is used within `web_app_shortcut_copier` since it is

validating that its parent process is Chrome. For the other callers it

is still correct to check both dynamic and static validity.



Validating only the dynamic code signature requires an awkward dance of

retrieving a `SecCodeRef` in order to retrieve the `Info.plist` from the

running process's code signature. This is then passed to

`SecCodeCopyGuestWithAttributes` via the

`kSecGuestAttributeDynamicCodeInfoPlist` /

`kSecGuestAttributeDynamicCode` attributes in order to retrieve a

`SecCodeRef` that will validate only the dynamic signature.



Bug: 324978880

entry.title: Support Feature Tile Dynamic Sizing
entry.content:
Have `FeatureTile` set a `MaximumFlexSizeRule` of `kUnbounded` so it can

dynamically stretch up to the maximum size of the container it is in,

instead of setting a fixed preferred size.



Since the tiles in QS do have a fixed size, set this preferred width and

update the `MaximumFlexRule` to use `kPreferred` from the side of

`FeatureTilesContainerView`. Also adjust pixel tests that don't recreate

the complete `QuickSettingsView` to match its sizing.



To see an example of dynamic sizing, see "display_detailed_view.cc".

entry.title: [Traffic Annotations] Remove confusing UserDataType enum values
entry.content:
The UserDataType enum has several confusing values. They're usually

there in any request. It's not clear whether you should *always* include

them, or *never* include them. Or why they even exist.



- IP_ADDRESS: any IP datagram contains this.

- USER_AGENT: any HTTP(S) request contains this.

- SESSION_ID: usually the same as ACCESS_TOKEN.

- TIMESTAMP: can always be derived by the server.



Remove the confusing options, and clarify what OTHER/NONE mean.

entry.title: Fix the flaky DnD test related to racy last active browser update.
entry.content:
This is a tentative fix for DetachToOwnWindowFromMaximizedWindow

DnD test, which is caused by race of async last active browser

update (b/325634285). Until we fix the root cause of b/325634285

by making last active browser update completely asynchronous, there

will always be a chance of such race causing the test flaky.



However, by adding the wait for the window being created in exo,

and last active browser being the expected browser, this may

help to mitigate the race issue for now.

entry.title: [Tab Group] Fix undo logic for stable tab group IDs
entry.content:
Currently undoing with tab groups of size 1 is broken. Why?



1) The destination group isn't updated to remove the tab group ID.

2) The check in TabListMediator for isTabInTabGroup doesn't work for

groups of size 1 if we need to add a new card when undoing a group

action 1-by-1. Instead we should add a card when undoing and a

tab or group of size 1 is not in the current set of tab cards.

3) Undo logic in TabGroupModelFilter wasn't consistently picking good

candidate group IDs for mergeListOfTabsToGroup. Fix that.

4) mergeTabsToGroup was hard to read. Rearrange the method so it is

more readable when adding the logic to include the destination

tab in the undo logic.



Bug: b/41496693

Change-Id: Ic71083dcea6a0c322a87190980b29d581b6190b9

entry.title: Move path transformation to the right spot in restore and endLayer
entry.content:
When restoring or closing a layer, we need to apply the transform on

the path before popping the stack to preserve the path coordinates as

they were while the matrix stack held that particular transform. In

PopAndRestore, this is done in the middle of the function, after doing

a first `restore`. This is technically wrong, even though it might not

have caused problem because the "real" restore changing the matrix was

after. Still, it's better to move the path transform to the beginning

of the function, before any stack level is popped.



Bug: 40249439

entry.title: Fix setTransform/resetTransform inside canvas layers
entry.content:
Canvas layers are recorded into a side recording until they are closed.

This is done so that we could flush the canvas up until the first

beginLayer since unclosed layers can't be flushed. When layers are

closed, the side recording gets inserted into the main one by using a

DrawRecordOp.



Now, DrawRecordOp was designed to draw recordings as if they had their

own matrix transform root. That is, if the drawn record contains a

SetMatrixOp, that matrix will be applied over the transform the canvas

had when DrawRecordOp was called. This is incompatible with how Canvas

layers work. Calling SetMatrixOp inside a layer should override the

global canvas matrix.



This CL reconciles the two behaviors by adding a `local_ctm` boolean

parameter in DrawRecordOp. When local_ctm is true, the record has a

local matrix stack which won't leak into the drawn canvas and will have

record-local SetMatrixOp. When local_ctm is false, the matrix

operations in the recording behaves as if they were part of the parent

recording.



Bug: 40249439

Fixed: 326503102

proceed for main frames.



PdfNavigationThrottle needs to check all navigations, so delete

PdfNavigationThrottle for every navigation.

clearer.

entry.title: Revert "media: Generate report when Cdm reads file > 40KB"
entry.content:
This reverts commit caa53e80d21a1485453bdf93b30d5d26d8bde337.



Reason for revert: We see crashes on the crash portal and we don't want

to promote this to stable, so we need to revert this CL.



Original change's description:

> media: Generate report when Cdm reads file > 40KB

>

> Use DumpWithoutCrashing to generate a report when a file that is over

> 40 KB is read by the CDM. The origin is already reported for all crashes

> so all that is needed to be done is to "fake crash" when > 40 KB.

>

> Tested it by changing the if condition to if(file_size_bytes > 0), and

> used the Integration Console to generate a crash.

>

> I then locally viewed the crash report using

> ```

> .\strings64.exe .\c2178a18-c44d-432b-9ca3-94e8cdb6c69b.dmp | grep -C2 excessive

> ```

>

> and saw

>

> ```

> cdm-origin

> https://integration.staging.widevine.com

> ```

>

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Avoid calling unhandled getPageContentData in guest mode
entry.content:
In guest mode, the multidevice page and associated routes do not exist.

Avoid calling getPageContentData() when the multidevice page is not

supported.

entry.title: Use scope-based InSequence in test expectations
entry.content:
These tests were doing `.InSequence(s)` on every expectations to

check API call ordering. This would be useful if multiple independent

sequences had to be checked in parallel, but it's not the case here.

It's less verbose to use a stack-based `InSequence` object. It's

also safer because it's easy to forget to include an `.InSequence(s)`

on some expectations (which was the case in a few tests, and which led to incorrectly ordered expectations).

entry.title: Fix CpuProbeManager crash on non-desktop platforms
entry.content:
CpuProbeManager is crashing because PressureManagerImpl is incorrectly

checking if cpu_probe_manager_ is null [1], instead of the CpuProbe that

cpu_probe_manager_ owns. As a result, on non-desktop platforms where

CpuProbe is nullptr, the check incorrectly passes and so

CpuProbeManager::EnsureStarted() is called, which crashes attempting to

call CpuProbe::StartSampling on the nullptr.



This CL changes PressureManagerImpl to use a factory to instantialize

CpuProbeManager, that will return a nullptr when the underlying CpuProbe

is nullptr. This way PressureManagerImpl doesn't need to know about

CpuProbe, and can keep using the current check.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/device/compute_pressure/pressure_manager_impl.cc;l=66



Bug: 326491562

Change-Id: I1bfcd1026c62188147759d87274d55ca32d7a438
